title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \

2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
A quick look at how life expectancy changes with GDP per capita.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px

df = px.data.gapminder().copy()
x = np.log10(df['gdpPercap'])
y = df['lifeExp']

coef = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)
fit = np.poly1d(coef)

plt.figure(figsize=(7,5))
plt.scatter(df['gdpPercap'], df['lifeExp'], alpha=0.4, s=18, c="#87CEFA")
x_sorted = np.linspace(df['gdpPercap'].min(), df['gdpPercap'].max(), 400)
plt.plot(x_sorted, fit(np.log10(x_sorted)), linewidth=2.0, c="#6A0DAD")
plt.xscale('log')
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita (log scale)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

print("slope_years_per_log10GDP =", round(coef[0], 2))
print("intercept =", round(coef[1], 2))








slope_years_per_log10GDP = 19.35
intercept = -9.1

title: Country Analysis
text:
Time trends for a chosen country. Change the value of country in the page header to analyze a different one.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px

gap = px.data.gapminder()
country = "{{params.country}}"
df = gap.query("country == @country").sort_values("year").copy()

plt.figure(figsize=(7,4))
plt.plot(df['year'], df['lifeExp'], marker='o', c="#6A0DAD")
plt.xlabel("Year"); plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title(f"Life Expectancy in {country}")
plt.tight_layout(); plt.show()

plt.figure(figsize=(7,4))
plt.plot(df['year'], df['gdpPercap'], marker='o', c="#6A0DAD")
plt.yscale('log')
plt.xlabel("Year"); plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita (log)")
plt.title(f"GDP per Capita in {country}")
plt.tight_layout(); plt.show()

plt.figure(figsize=(7,4))
plt.plot(df['year'], df['pop'], marker='o', c="#6A0DAD")
plt.xlabel("Year"); plt.ylabel("Population")
plt.title(f"Population in {country}")
plt.tight_layout(); plt.show()

print(f"rows: {len(df)}, years covered: {df['year'].min()}–{df['year'].max()}")






















rows: 0, years covered: nan–nan

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Checking if life expectancy varies with population.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px

df = px.data.gapminder().copy()

plt.figure(figsize=(7,5))
plt.scatter(df['pop'], df['lifeExp'], alpha=0.35, s=18, c="#87CEFA")
bins = np.quantile(df['pop'], np.linspace(0, 1, 60))
bin_idx = np.digitize(df['pop'], bins, right=True)
x_bin = pd.Series(df['pop']).groupby(bin_idx).median()
y_bin = pd.Series(df['lifeExp']).groupby(bin_idx).mean()
plt.plot(x_bin, y_bin, linewidth=2.0, c="#6A0DAD")
plt.xscale('log')
plt.xlabel("Population (log scale)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
